intro: Ritchiea gossweileri, commonly known as the Gossweiler’s cycad, is a rare and ancient plant species belonging to the Cycadaceae family. It is native to the coastal regions of southern Africa, particularly in South Africa and Namibia. This plant is characterized by its stout, unbranched stem and a crown of large, pinnate leaves that are typically a deep green color. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires a warm, dry climate. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Ritchiea gossweileri is considered a vulnerable species, highlighting the importance of conservation efforts to protect it.
